SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

evs.data.fileio.ohdfile.misc
Class HString

java.lang.Object
  evs.data.fileio.ohdfile.misc.HString

public abstract class HString
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides static methods for String related functionality. The method getKeyFromString(...) reads in a String of a specified format and extracts the value of the key String from within it. This used by HCalendar to acquire the date fields from a specifically formatted date string. The method replaceSubstring(...) puts key values into a String of specified format. The methods readBinaryString(...) and writeBinaryString(...) can be used to read/write Strings from Fortran written files where the Strings are disguised as floating point numbers (for example, see ESPData).

Author:
hank

Method Detail

getKeyFromString

public static java.lang.String getKeyFromString(java.lang.String str,
                                                java.lang.String format,
                                                java.lang.String key)
Given a string format, a string following that format, and a key, return the characters from string which are in the same positions that key is in within the format string. Example:

string: 1999-01-10 -- format: ccyy-mm-dd -- key: yy

This would result in a return value of "99".

Parameters:
str -
format -
key -
Returns:
String corresponding to key in str.

replaceSubstring

public static java.lang.String replaceSubstring(java.lang.String str,
                                                java.lang.String key,
                                                java.lang.String value)
Finds key within str, removes it, and inserts value in its place. If the key isn't found, it returns the entire string, with nothing replaced.

Parameters:
str -
key -
value -
Returns:
new String

alphabetize

public static java.util.Vector alphabetize(java.util.Vector strings)
Alphabetize the passed in Vector of Strings and return the ordered Vector. I choose to use collation keys, because Java in a Nutshell says this may be a more efficient way to compare strings.

Parameters:
strings -
Returns:
Ordered vector.

formatStringToFieldWidth

public static java.lang.String formatStringToFieldWidth(int width,
                                                        java.lang.String word,
                                                        boolean leftjustified)
Format a string to be of a specific field width by filling in spaces either after if leftjustified is true, or before otherwise. If the word is already larger than width, then this will remove the larger digits.

Parameters:
width -
word -
leftjustified -
Returns:
Formatted String.

wordWrap

public static java.lang.String wordWrap(java.lang.String word,
                                        int maxLineLength)
This method will word wrap a String, adding \n to set the String so that it does not exceed the desired field width. If a line MUST exceed the maxLineLength (because a word is too long), then it will be forced onto its own line.

Parameters:
word - The word to wrap
maxLineLength - The largest allowable length for any line.
Returns:
wrapped string

addStringToVector

public static boolean addStringToVector(java.util.Vector v,

Add the element to the list if necessary. Return false if it was not necessary to add the string. Return true otherwise. "Necessary" means it is not already in the list.

Parameters:

word -
